answers.answer: dont you worry about a thing! besides the numbness/tingling is in your feet, not your hands so you can still type here on the computer! i am sure its something simple (not enough circulation..) but once the dr. sees you, let us know how it went.

good luck tomorrow - it could be lots of things. maybe a pinched nerve?  hmmmm....have you been sitting in one place for extended periods of time, using a repetitive motion?  j/k  i'll be thinking about you tomorrow.
yeah, sk...kicking her hubby in the a**!! hehe heh...
i read that your thyroid can cause hands or feet to go numb. may you be healthy and it just be your computer chair!
good luck sweetheart!!! I'm sure everything will be fine, love you long time!!
There can be lots of reasons, but it's important to rule out the big ones first.  Then you can concentrate on if it's something obscure.I'm sorry if I made you worry, though.  Post later!

glad2bamom,I hope you have a good visit with your physician. I also sometimes get tingling in my feet if I have them crossed and/or my arms - from lying on them. I think mine is from inflammation. From what I'm reading on these boards, it sounds like it is becoming more common. I've also heard that people can get tingling from a vitamin B deficiency, diabetes, thyroid (mentioned) or a herniated disk. Lack of blood supply, as well can cause tingling/numbness.
hey girl.. are you back yet or did you have to get it amputated? totally kidding. i am confident it went well. just come back and let us know! you should have been back by now.
I'm getting nervous.  Shouldn't she have reported in?
I have been wondering about her today?!  Doesn't she realize that we're sittin around waiting for her diagnosis?  I hope she is ok....
there she goes again being a good mom and wife. darn her!
we need to discuss her priorities!i hope you're okay and we hear from you soon

question: This isn't at all about marriage, it's just one that I chose for a topic.Ya'll remember when I posted about numbness/tingling in my feet?  Well, I bit the bullet and I'm going to the doc tomorrow at 10:30.  All ye who know me, know that I am a freak, so I'm scared to death.  I've looked online (stupid, I know)and I could have everything from a back problem to MS to ALS to who knows what else.  Fortunately, I only have the one symptom.  Nothing else is going on.  Maybe its a pinched nerve or something.Just thought I'd get my good friends here to say a prayer or two that it's nothing---I have two small kids and I need to stay healthy to take care of them.  Besides, if I'm sick, I can't possibly stay on the computer for so long---Thanks, Who, you're the one that convinced me.Love to you all--
title: Wish me luck--going to doc
